author: Gyen Ming Angel
comment: Pokemon runs full speed for me, which I found very impressive, and the tilt controls are alright. I much prefer the touch controls, however if you accidentally partially drag the screen while trying to input a direction it then thinks that you're holding the direction, and the only way to fix it is to start from the last save. I'd also like to see more customisation over the controls- even having faint outlines where the buttons are would be very helpful. Destroys battery too...
title: Excellent proof of concept, but needs a lot of work

author: Chris Kurz
comment: This app works great! Honestly, even playing pokemon with the dpad mapped to motion controls feels too cumbersome. But playing with all touch works great. It would be cool if there was an option for a simple mask to help me see the borders of each button. Even a simple transparent 3x3 grid would be perfect. All in all, its worth the money IMO!                       PS:  where the directional button sticks when you accidentally swipe....just press the directional button that is stuck and an t will reset.
title: Great little app!

author: Jimmy Glasscock
comment: I suggest adding more options, such as customizable controls, linear filtering toggle, an option to color original gameboy games, maybe an option that allows you to edit the opacity of the controls. The tilt controls toggle doesn't work. And as a side note, maybe an NES wrist emulator app, and Gameboy Advance wrist emulator (with a frameskip option). I seriously recommend this app and love it. Thank you for your support.
title: Some Suggestions...

author: Jordan Rickel
comment: Amazing feat right here.   Works with some not all games but for what it is now, it is amazing.   I just hope the developer doesn't give up on This program.   Also an optional D-pad would be amazing (never mind disabling tilt enables the virtual d pad).  Keep up the good work.
title: Please don't stop working on this

author: K R
comment: Thank you for creating this app. I love the concept. I have asus zenwatch2 and got some games to run smoothly but I have the color issue B&w only and some objects are not showing. So not sure if this is meant for original b&w games only or not. Will DL some different roms and see if there is any difference. Would love to see NES or game gear emulator in future. That would be sweeeet.
title: This is great

author: Cooper Tribett
comment: This is awesome, no arguing with that. However, it can be quite buggy and slow down a lot. It would also be amazing if more control options were given such as Bluetooth controllers
title: Great! But it has plenty of room for improvement

author: Søren Romano
comment: The app doesnt send roms from my note 4 to my lg g watch. And the tilt controls toggle doesnt work. Very disappointed. Hopefully this will get fixed soon since i hate paying for faulty apps. Great concept though and i hope it gets fixed up.
title: Not sending roms to watch

author: Justin Coburn
comment: I love the idea of an entire Game Boy at the wrist. I just wish there were certain things, like a way to calibrate for the gyro, so I didn't need to hold it so precisely. Also hope the color issue can be remedied.
title: Idea is grade A, execution is maybe a C

author: Model Z
comment: I've been wanting one of these for quite some time! It still has room for improvement though. Save states sometimes crash and make that save unplayable, so multiple manual save states in addition to the one auto save state would help. Also, it would be nice to bring the save file from the watch back to the phone (for moving from one device to another)
title: Finally!

author: travis farley
comment: The tilt controls kind of suck, but there's the on screen option, so that makes everything better. I wish it supported normal game boy games, they don't look right and very few are playable. The color ones are great, though.
title: It works pretty flawlessly with game boy color games

author: David McIntyre
comment: Works great with GBC games but original Gameboy games seem to have the contrast backwards. Where it should be white it's black and makes the games unplayable. If there's a way to fix that issue I'd gladly rate it a 5.

author: jason jones
comment: Crashes on a lot of ROMs. Does not let you delete ones that don't work and its fiddly to use. But its still excellent. Update fixes the delete ROMs that don't work problem. Nice one have an extra star
title: So far pretty cool

author: Joel Huff
comment: On the Moto 360 (picked up yesterday) the display seems to be broken. The game will be displayed when swiping left (like to close it) but won't display when it's actually supposed to. The game is running, but the screen is black until I swipe left. A fix would be appreciated, the app looks clean and runs pretty well!
title: Needs a fix

author: Bryce G
comment: So awesome! Works great with Pokemon Crystal and Pokemon TCG. Legendary Super Warriors runs fine but combos can't be done properly with tilt controls. Luckily you can turn off tilt controls and use touch input for directions as well (the 2x2 control grid pictured above becomes a 3x3 grid with directions added). My one suggestion would be to add sound (my ZenWatch 2 has a speaker and other watches can use Bluetooth headsets)

author: Matt Falcon
comment: I never knew any GBC games, so of course the first games I try are Mario Land 2 and Tetris. Both original GB games seem to have severe color (greyscale) pallette issues with grey appearing as black, making some screens unreadable. The tilt controls are also a bit difficult to work with (would prefer to be able to replace Start/Select with left/right, and use motion gestures for down/up, for example). Also, if a notification comes in during play, it freezes the game - but thanks to save states, nothing lost.
title: Proof of concept, works but glitchy.

author: Brion Fallon
comment: Brilliant!  No complaints. Wonderful on moto360.  Some humble beggings though... 1: could it be possible to add a sesitvity setting for the tilt directions.  2: I would be eternally greatful if you managed a sega genesis or master system emulator.  Those requests would be delightful! Devs rock!
title: Excellent!

author: Mike Smith
comment: very kool app it makes everyone i show very jealous the only thing it needs to be perfect is support for a bluetooth game pad that would make it really the best app for wear out there just that one thing
title: great app almost perfect

author: Nate Hiteshew
comment: Tried every rom I could find won't work please help and I'll rate 5 stars! I just want to play dragon warrior 3 on my wrist!!
title: Dragon warrior 3 wont work

author: Jimmy Hadden
comment: The tilt controls are pretty horrible
title: Needs work with controls

author: Steven Watson
comment: On the sony smartwatch 3 there is black bar across the bottom with what i think is a battery indicator in the lower right hand side, it would be good if I had the option to turn this off and make games full screen. Multiple save states would be amazing too but not necessary

author: Edwin Santiago
comment: My only complaint is I would like the option to press the buttons faster  and move the game screen down a little bit on the Motorola 360 gen 1,other then that it runs great!
title: Great Idea and runs great!

author: Aaron Murphy-Jones
comment: Pokemon is running well for me but Mario Kart seems to crash the app
title: Excellent concept but needs work

author: Shubh Jsh
comment: Okay app but it doesn't have sound support. My watch has an inbuilt speaker and sound support would do wonders. Also the 1st Gen Pokemon games have some contrast bugs which make them unplayable

author: Jeremy Miller
comment: It works for me, had to try a few roms out before I found one that the color looked right. Only wish the sounds worked but maybe that's a rom issue.
title: Works well

author: Mike Zah
comment: This is why I have a smart watch. Keep up the good work can't wait to try more from u.   Some pointers the tilt control needs a way to center it to the way u have ur arm or angle u have it at. Maybe even some Bluetooth remote control support
title: Great work

author: Lucas Jorna
comment: Getting a black screen when I start a game a lot of the time. Also, please add an option to edit the controls, because I have black bars but I can't use them for controls. (Huawei watch 2) Please continue working on this!!

author: Nathan Post
comment: This is awesome. Save states and Bluetooth controller support are a must though, and a way to overscan the image to fill circular displays would be great too. Will update to 5 stars if so!

author: Connor
comment: Oh my gosh. This is seriously the coolest thing. I've enjoyed playing some of my favorite games on my watch. I would easily pay for a gba emulator as well.

author: Nick d
comment: I can't turn off tilt controls. And it makes the game unplayable. I'm on an Asus ZenWatch 2.

author: Nick Jordon
comment: When I open a rom, it just goes black.
title: Just doesn't work

author: Hyun Kim
comment: Awesome! Definitely needs some bug fixes minor, but totally worth the money and setup is a breeze! I can play Pokemon full speed lol.

author: Pitudo Gaming
comment: I dont know how to start it on gs6 edge and galaxy gear live

author: stuffball2000
comment: Would be 5 stars im sure but i cant get it to show up on my moto 360 i bought the app and its on my phone it  just doesnt show up on my watch.

author: Stephen Blumenstein
comment: On Moto 360 1st gen, only displays one shade of grey, everything else is black. Same results on every game I try.
title: Impressive, but...

author: Foco Fundie
comment: I'd like to be able to customise the controls. I have a round watch to i could use the borders as direccional buttons.

author: skatecar
comment: Works perfectly with tetris DX only problem is it doesn't keep save states but other than that it works fine.

author: Toby Gamr
comment: Whilst emulation is smooth, it has serious issues with display, for example, In Pokémon Blue, text boxes and menus are entirely black and impossible to read.
Works Great! Runs smoothly on my LG Watch Sport. Any plans to add sound? Button Mapping would be great as well.

author: Satyam Poonith
comment: This app is SOOOO good. I added a ROM to my gear 2 neo of Android wear and it still works perfectly.
title: Worth the money

author: Jess Li
comment: Please create a GBA emulator too that would be so cool!
title: Awesome!
